channel.title: Blocking websites with your own password XD
channel.description:
well in this tutorial im going to show you how to block a website with you own password. [b]step1:[/b] open controle pannel [b]step2:[/b] now find "[i]internet options[/i]" and double click on it. [b]step3:[/b] then click on "[i]content[/i]" [b]step4:[/b] then in the bit about "[i]content adviser[/i]" then "[i]settings[/i]" [b]step5:[/b] now click "[i]approved sites[/i]" [b]step6:[/b] now type in the website you want to add a password to. then click never once your done. [b]step7:[/b] now click "[i]apply[/i]" and hopfully it will ask you for a password. [b]step8:[/b] now enter your password and click [b]OK[/b] for all the boxes. [b]step9:[/b] now open your browser and go to the site url you typed in.
and your done

item.title: Blocking websites with your own password XD

item.description:

[/quote]

pie!!!bacon in the pants!!1[/quote]

Also 99% use routers… Blocking websites via your router is much more secure?

item.title: Blocking websites with your own password XD
item.dc:creator: @devull devull
item.description:
@devull wrote:

well in this tutorial im going to show you how to block a website with you own password.
step1: open controle pannel
step2: now find “internet options” and double click on it.
step3: then click on “content”
step4: then in the bit about “content adviser” then “settings”
step5: now click “approved sites”
step6: now type in the website you want to add a password to. then click never once your done.
step7: now click “apply” and hopfully it will ask you for a password.
step8: now enter your password and click OK for all the boxes.
step9: now open your browser and go to the site url you typed in.

                                    and your done

Read full topic
item.source: Blocking websites with your own password XD
